definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: LX, do you see in the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 楼下的，又看见你在上网了。

sentences.english: The sink is broken in the one downstairs.
sentences.chinese: 楼下那间的下水管坏了。

sentences.english: It is not clear how many survived the collapse of the three-storey building.
sentences.chinese: 倒塌的三层楼下还有多少幸存者目前还不得而知。

sentences.english: Consecutive art space upstairs and downstairs is everyone's life stage.
sentences.chinese: 楼上楼下连贯的艺术空间，是每个人的生活舞台。
楼下是一家新开的餐馆。

sentences.english: The timed light always goes out before I can reach the landing.
sentences.chinese: 定时感应灯通常还没等我走到楼下就熄灭了。

sentences.english: He walks out and goes to his downstairs office, and everyone just kind of stands there.
sentences.chinese: 他走了出去返回楼下的办公室，而所有人都愣在当场。

sentences.english: Soon, however, the water i ide had risen to the stairway landing.
sentences.chinese: 可是不多时，楼下的河水已涨到了楼梯平台上。

sentences.english: If in an upper apartment, flood the bathroom to cause water to flood the apartment below.
sentences.chinese: 如在楼上就开水淹掉浴室，让水流到楼下。

sentences.english: Kayla came back downstairs with a worried expression on her face.
sentences.chinese: 这时凯拉从楼下上来，脸上带着惊慌的表情。

sentences.english: Do you e-mail your colleague down the hall, or get up and go and see her?
sentences.chinese: 你是给你楼下的同事发邮件还是起来去看她？

sentences.english: We ate downstairs in Mr. and Mrs. Kim’s apartment. They were our landlords.
sentences.chinese: 我们在楼下金先生金太太的房间吃饭，他们是房东。

sentences.english: From downstairs, his mom shouts it's suppertime.
sentences.chinese: 他妈在楼下叫他吃晚饭。

sentences.english: He was found on the morning of the first day in his room downstairs helpless with pain.
sentences.chinese: 发病那天上午人家在楼下他的房间里发现他疼得利害。

sentences.english: "He's been in his room all day, " the landlady said downstairs.
sentences.chinese: “他已经在屋里呆了一整天，”女房东在楼下说。

sentences.english: Kunta thought, to carry sick men upstairs for treatment.
sentences.chinese: 带一些生病的人到楼下去看病。

definition: upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
head of a flight of stairs
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
outside (also pr. [wai4 mian5] for this sense)/surface/exterior/external appearance
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
outside/outer surface/abroad/place other than one's home
